alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 8:16PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Rock Island, northwestern Whiteside, southeastern Carroll, southeastern Cedar, Scott, northern Muscatine and Clinton Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 816 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Preston to near Conesville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Charlotte around 820 PM CDT. Andover around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Clinton, Fulton, Muscatine, Argo Fay, Fairhaven, Chadwick and Fairport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 266 and 301. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
